channel.title: Nehrim
channel.description:
[url]https://www.moddb.com/mods/nehrim-at-fates-edge[/url]
Total conversion Oblivion mod. Download it. Its awesome.
Not convinced? Well then, allow me to elaborate. Basically its a total conversion mod with an all new world (i.e. new lore, races, everything, no more tamriel). Its world space is the size of Oblivion, and hand detailed, meaning everything looks incredible, this coupled with improved graphics. Gameplay is modified from Oblivion slightly but still the same slap with sword/spell/arrow until dead, with some new spells. Leveling up is changed to a mix of XP and skill increase mix, which works well. It does have that "Oblivion was too easy must make supa hard" mentality, and as such I had to put it on easy so I could just enjoy the scenery without being almost killed by Wolves every five feet. Overall though I'm loving it, the world is just so much more explorable than Oblivion's.
Also its in German but has English subtitles.

item.title: Nehrim
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
No, it installs to a separate directory, you can keep all your mods.

Read full topic

I’ve beat Oblivion and the DLCs once and loved them, so I’ll have to check this out. I’m guessing I’ll need a clean install with no mods activated, hm?

Geez I’m currently working on beating the original Oblivion now and now this. Guess my gaming life is booked for the next 2 years… Amazing trailer by the way.

item.title: Nehrim
item.dc:creator: Hazzmat
item.description:
Where the hell can you find that kidnapped woman in the quest that you get from that woman in the first parts of the game. Quest log says I have to look NW starting from the basket but no luck so far. I even searched the entire area around the city of Erothin but to no avail. Please help.

Read full topic

item.title: Nehrim
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
https://www.moddb.com/mods/nehrim-at-fates-edge

Total conversion Oblivion mod. Download it. Its awesome.

Not convinced? Well then, allow me to elaborate. Basically its a total conversion mod with an all new world (i.e. new lore, races, everything, no more tamriel). Its world space is the size of Oblivion, and hand detailed, meaning everything looks incredible, this coupled with improved graphics.
Gameplay is modified from Oblivion slightly but still the same slap with sword/spell/arrow until dead, with some new spells. Leveling up is changed to a mix of XP and skill increase mix, which works well. It does have that “Oblivion was too easy must make supa hard” mentality, and as such I had to put it on easy so I could just enjoy the scenery without being almost killed by Wolves every five feet.
